22D90424366F470A9FEEF1AB244EF41D.description: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.

0BD5D1A33355443F87BEB778D834AC76.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

856B5F73468D4ED1A13E04639B3736E8.description: Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking audibly in coherent sentences.

DAB9879166054B43BDE6ABC3F7383157.description: Standard 2: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas

7D94F8D8EF04460AAB513C26CEECF584.description: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or issue.

D3D776AE22524782A157FAF3EA6592B9.description: Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.

1DAB9C280E2847FE90A0380133A0A5A3.description: Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under discussion.

8D54B2BA957B4A67A19504C0630217DB.description: Build on othersâ€™ talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others.

DE8DC541C9C4449A8CF2D71E12A89231.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).

FB67BFF6D22C4C97BC0CB8BA52ABA110.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with a variety of partners about developmentally appropriate topics in small and larger groups.

B71D8054EEA843BC9DC0A017F48C09C7.description: Use new words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading, being read to, and responding to texts in order to express themselves precisely, clearly, and fluently through multiple forms of communication.

0C4E9206B4AC4A4587EE3E5B90FF0191.description: Sort words with the same first letter in A-B-C order.  Clarification: A-B-C order, while not specifically addressed in a singular benchmark, the explicit application of this skill lays the foundation for future use of reference materials.

A9ADFE301CF1442AAD182D135C583919.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).

392B2619C73845DC8639A5A87875F5DD.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).

1E5C16D34035404EA91545EE21B9DB06.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe foods that are spicy or juicy).

29D6AEE66DA843A3951FD73392A7D4FB.description: Demonstrate independent understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

641FF44385414D3399A92835B16B68ED.description: Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to predict the meaning of compound words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf, notebook, bookmark).

96FC292C003446B5831911472372DD3F.description: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., addition, additional).

022CDB84353742B5B9603429DF91B9F1.description: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to a known word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).

A1DA7B0053C04C868F0FF3885209E634.description: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.

E029A420B9784E069480886F63B603CA.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 2 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies. Students will acquire new vocabulary using the following explicitly taught strategies:

82BC22A34A874427BE7D96477F7FD94C.description: Compare formal and informal uses of English.

608D4C4AF16A432FAD1BCAEAC5505C87.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking,or reading.

D5956EDFA2934AF8832CBDB00033B3A3.description: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.

ACAAD7E74C6A41629EC2CE122E0AE16C.description: Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words (e.g., cage â†’ badge; boy â†’ boil).

2647CE068AF441EA86BC9626132FDCE7.description: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.

14FBB5FFB2454CCC92C910E95150F030.description: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.

4541A5E870EC41DFB8ECACBCAE13F968.description: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.

4C9F2E050B5E4403AB5026D1A0D1AD4E.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

C0689CD2CBD5436A8F472836992735F0.description: Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences (e.g., The boy watched the movie; The little boy watched the movie; The action movie was watched by the little boy).

25BCF55D8D1A4DA5ABE43B43A84FE83B.description: Use adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.

4CB1229B79434E5DB945C1D605DA1228.description: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).

3F5229B4018C421B9DC29268D1150A4F.description: Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).

213DBE95E79E44668F51F8189683F935.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

DF4A882F6C8F47A4ACA912DD53B3728E.description: Students will be able to write a five sentence paragraph on a topic that uses correct capitalization and end punctuation, and includes a topic sentence, three detailed supporting sentences, and a concluding sentence.

D1EB2E5CD128493F8565C784E5E123B5.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

487216D58DBB4AE3BEAFE9A94F1E8A5E.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations).

F3F2339AD9D8436DB5864E657D0478E6.description: Standard 3:   Research to Build and Present Knowledge

3BECC01930C44DF98409308A7C3600F6.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

4E6C17F1E47A44A9AD475CB91AC5773B.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations).

22F1785B9E29485BB2F451CBB07AF1A8.description: Standard 2:  Production and Distribution of Writing

A22547E4637645A9AEBEDD2C22ED4028.description: Through a progression moving from three related sentences to a five sentence paragraph format, students will write narratives in which they use a topic sentences to introduce and recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use transition words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.

7BC3CA2864C84194A6CDF24A51109F22.description: Through a progression moving from three related sentences to a five sentence paragraph format, students will share informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a topic using a defined topic sentence, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide a concluding statement or section.

7C6660F3FAA640D5A42F647D91487F6C.description: Through a progression moving from three related sentences to a five sentence paragraph format, students will express their opinions in writing including a defined topic sentence, use of transition words to connect opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement.

A39D02CA458E423385D8524F3BE148CB.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories and poetry, in the grades 2â€“3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

C1EE308E8FB74F6CA64F22B715BC3ECC.description: Standard 4: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

162AF816E4E54E199D3A8EB845AEAF82.description: Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors or from different cultures.

4F81F750836940BBBC17F845B8C61899.description: Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.

0D1D7A210CA74D6F8A2014EE4D87309A.description: Standard 3: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

EC50F4089219483490C7F234D8C733E5.description: Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.

9AD3BBCA87B44DB092E1D8A7A8E2CF4E.description: Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.

3B13F8F7B8A44DF3B7087BCCEA15AEE4.description: Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.

5A2298E02884492583FCABF806970BB1.description: Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.

8D4FE410376E49F981BEC79709D26A47.description: Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures, and determine their central message, lesson, or moral.

D55BEE6E60694FC499B7879ADEF3A5B1.description: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

D87A6A96C73A4A328F346601A805967C.description: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grade 2 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.

49C26DAB634A4F1BA865C278C035CA89.description: Standard 4: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E7EB9AAE28444C64BE55BCE11FEF2D2E.description: Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.

A00C16756366480B89ECC93AD0D110D6.description: Describe how an author uses reasons to support specific points in a text.

D4E20BE0CA1949AEB2B68EEC2E110A4F.description: Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.

B7FBFD29B44840349B8FFEDC62DA4083.description: Standard 3: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas

958E17D1DA044B3DB39610028A78E1A3.description: Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.

DD095CC7A0CA4AF292801BEB41EEA64D.description: Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.

47F1DA7A900B47A4A8CB73831395A79F.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.

598F8D63F26D432F90568F96D97CF048.description: Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.

513B4EEA1619474C90A68B27295F0CF9.description: Identify the main topic of a multiparagraph text as well as the focus of specific paragraphs within the text.

DB45DB84135E4D2396F65BA4E765C76C.description: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.

0A31C9722198409B8112EA70285AB632.description: Strand: Reading Standards for Informational Text

9D36CE7CD559428C84BD7395C76EE220.description: Fluently read connected text at a rate of 100 Words Correct Per Minute (WCPM) with greater than 96% accuracy (50th percentile).  For the purpose of fluency, the End-of-Year target was derived from range of researched-based high-frequency word list including Dibels.

B35C224133624B0095172727DBDFB5C7.description: Fluently read a range of high frequency words (43-69) in a minute.

253F68B6C45744A49B6EA92FFC571E2C.description: Fluently read nonsense words (22-38) in a minute.

BB8B0179D5AC4BE5AF3CF4A64BAF387C.description: Fluently articulate individual phonemes in nonsense words (76-116).

B4B10508934E4F46A1FDAEEABA1FCEFF.description: Students will be able to with speed and accuracy:

0D0FB044D3A340F8AE053B1595922AF5.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

E771BDB9157F4C1A9161C47291DE0308.description: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.

6EDCAD7836BD41A28C1D476BCF5BC279.description: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.

E3BC68FAA61A48EF937B36238D53C231.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

D038096F8AEC47E2AF22A432AD5C5432.description: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.

3E0943C84D364F03AE0336A6948524B4.description: Decode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

2929095F8D6C4B02A4D37CEBC1B1B419.description: Know spelling-sound correspondences for additional common vowel teams.

E024B211E38A474793F7C4ABCCB3116A.description: Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled one-syllable words (ex. be, bed, my, go).

7B96C034B1434F3B97FD1E39F4745366.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.
